description: a- (“in, on”) +‎ building (“the act or process of building”)

entries.meaning: (archaic, excluding US) Being built or under construction, as a structure or a vessel. [First attested in the mid 16th century.]
examples: Heere we made a double floore in the hall where the shippe was abuilding, so that the wild men, being ignorant of our way of building, could not take any notice of our cuningnesse, which proved to our desire.

entries.meaning: (archaic, excluding US) Developing or arising, as a trend or an idea. [First attested in the mid 16th century.]
examples: This may signify much; among other things that the courtesan is creeping into social favor—even that a new code of morals is now abuilding, in which she will be the grand exemplar.
